Instruction: Preheat oven to 375Â°F. Slice chicken breasts horizontally to make thinner cutlets. Season with salt and black pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken cutlets for 3-4 minutes per side or until golden brown and cooked through. Remove from skillet and let cool.
Cut the Romaine lettuce into bite-sized pieces and place them in a large salad bowl.
In a small bowl, combine Caesar dressing, freshly squeezed lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper. Whisk until well combined.
Add croutons and grated Parmesan cheese to the bowl with Romaine lettuce.
Slice the cooked chicken cutlets into strips and add them to the salad bowl.
Pour the prepared Caesar dressing over the salad ingredients.
Toss the salad gently until all ingredients are evenly coated with the dressing.
Serve immediately as an appetizer or as a main course.
